body_html:
Ok, looks like this is now only breaking the cmake build

I think we can probably follow the directions for abseil here:
https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp/tree/master/CMake

and add a dependency to tensorflow/contrib/cmake/external/ ? (The other cmake dependencies live here it seems).

According to https://bazel.build/, bazel runs on windows.. Is it necessary to maintain an entirely separate build system? Seems like it will mean extra maintenance work.

If the above steps seem reasonable I can take a look tonight after work and try to build out the cmake dep for absiel.

body:
Ok, looks like this is now only breaking the cmake build

I think we can probably follow the directions for abseil here:
https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp/tree/master/CMake

and add a dependency to tensorflow/contrib/cmake/external/ ? (The other cmake dependencies live here it seems).

According to https://bazel.build/, bazel runs on windows.. Is it necessary to maintain an entirely separate build system? Seems like it will mean extra maintenance work.

If the above steps seem reasonable I can take a look tonight after work and try to build out the cmake dep for absiel.
